name: Sofitel Rome Villa Borghese

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel that maintains the Sofitel standards. We liked it because it was in a quite location, not on the main streets but just a short walk from the Spanish Steps.
reviews.title: Nice Romantic Hideaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was very luxurious - though not large. And this is one of the hotels that still has an evening bed turn-down service (at least our room did).
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel on the whole is very well run and the staff are very attentive. The views from the rooftop restaurant are beautiful both during the day but especially in the evenings. The meal portions are what you would expect from a hotel of this calibre (very well made but small) - having tried one of the restaurants around the corner from the hotel (Il Picolo Mondo - I was not impressed) we decided we'd continue eating at the hotel if we were nearby.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, but hike from the metro

reviews.text: Apart from the Vatican, you can pretty much walk to most of the important ruins (colloseum about 20 minute walk)
reviews.title: Very comfortable, attractive, well run hotel.

reviews.text: The only downside that comes to mind is that there's no gym/pool facility in the hotel. They have an agreement with an establishment somewhere nearby.
reviews.title: Going back!

reviews.text: The staff at all levels are to be congratulated on their friendliness, hospitality and efficiency. The rooms were large and very confortable and as usual Sofitel beds and pillows can´t be surpasssed.
reviews.title: Great breakfast

reviews.text: Breakfast was included for my wife and I and we paid for my grandaughter. EUROS 30,00 is a little steep.
reviews.title: Incredible view

reviews.text: Otherwise only positive memories especially overlooking the city and Borghese gardens from the roof top bar.
reviews.title: Great hotel, good location.

reviews.text: This is a great example of a hotel that offers friendly, helpful and genuine service throughout. I was truly bowled over by this wonderful Team, who could not do enough to make sure we had a wonderful stay. OK - the hotel is quite old in decor and the restaurant on the roof is over priced. But it shows that they are making do with what the company have given them and are certainly ensuring that guests leave, having had a great experience. The location is superb - close to the Spanish Steps and Villa Borghese, in a elegant part of the city. The hotel is historic and although rooms are a little dated in decor, they are however in good condition and offer everything you would expect from a five star experience (complimentary WiFi, Bose Stereo, Hermes Amenities in the Bathroom etc...). There is a great Bar/Restaurant on the roof - with stunning sunset views over the city. Pity the restaurant prices are ridiculously high. Breakfast is served in the lower ground floor and is an excellent selection (but you pay Euro 30 for it). If Sofitel invested in an update to the decor, this would be one of the best options in Rome. In the meantime - go for the wonderful staff and service.
reviews.title: Superb Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the five star sofitel hotel in Rome which was an absolute delight. It was our first wedding anniversary and therefore we wanted this trip to be very special and the hotel did not let us down with superb beautifully dressed rooms which looked totally independent and not part of a 'chain'. The hotel service levels, from all manner of the hotel team, were exceptional, helping to book tickets and having macs to use in the hotel lobby. We decided on our first night to use the rooftop terrace restaurant, which we later found out had just been voted the best rooftop terace in europe. Prices in the restaurant were a little on the heavy side but we chose the 7 course extravaganza which was exquisite, and after all we were in central rome. The chef would pop out occasionally and discuss the food and the background to his training which was very interesting. All in all a wonderful experience in this hotel and we would have no hesitation in returning.
reviews.title: BEAUTIFUL 5 STAR HOTEL

reviews.text: Hotel was very nice and staff friendly.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Hard to fault

reviews.text: We stayed at Sofitel for 4 nights in December and January. The location of the hotel is great! Just few minutes walk from the very city centre, on a very quiet street. The stuff is VERY friendly and helpful!
reviews.title: Great! We love Sofitel
Sofitel Rome
reviews.text: The rooms are a bit old, especially carpets, but in Rome everything's seems to be quite old! :)

reviews.title: Understated elegance in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything was great! This stay at Sofitel in Roma was our fourh stay in Rome and in this hotel)
reviews.title: Great hotel in good location

description: A 19th-century palace on a quiest street, minutes from mythical sites and lively neighborhoods. Sofitel Roma is a five-star Rome hotel in the vibrant heart of the "Eternal City" - between Via Veneto, the Spanish Steps, and overlooking the Villa Borghese gardens. It offers 104 elegant guest rooms, including 4 suites with private terraces and balcony, as well as three luxurious meeting rooms. Start the day with an energizing selection of French and Italian specialties at the elegant Restaurant "Le 49".Enjoy delightful drinks and divine Mediterranean cuisine at the splendorous rooftop restaurant "La Terrasse Cuisine & Lounge". French-style living and devoted personalized service à l'italienne. Treat yourself to this central Rome hotel - equally suitable for business trips and cultural travel experiences.
